meanings.definition: A United States coin worth five cents.
meanings.sent1: I found two nickels in my pocket.
meanings.sent2: She used five nickels to buy a candy bar.
meanings.sent3: The vending machine only accepted nickels, so I had to search for some.
meanings.sent4: His smile was as bright as a shiny nickel.
meanings.sent5: The sound of nickels clinking together is music to my ears.

meanings.definition: To make a small cut or notch in.
meanings.sent1: He carefully nickels the paper to create a decorative edge.
meanings.sent2: The tailor nickels the fabric before sewing it together.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally nickels my finger while trying to open the package.
meanings.sent4: The sculptor nickels away at the marble to reveal the statue within.
meanings.sent5: The chef nickels the vegetables for garnish with precision.

meanings.sent1: The mischievous raccoon nickels food from the campsite.
meanings.sent2: She always nickels pens from her coworkers' desks.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky cat nickels socks and hides them under the bed.
meanings.sent4: The pickpocket nickels wallets in crowded places.
meanings.sent5: The pirate crew nickels treasures from unsuspecting ships.
